com.smartsockets
Class TipcCache

java.lang.Object
  com.smartsockets.TipcCache
public class TipcCache
extends java.lang.Object

Provides an interface to access the messages cached by the SmartSockets Cache daemon.

Constructor Detail

TipcCache

public TipcCache()
Initializes the SmartCache options for request_subject and request_timeout and therefore, should be called before any command files are read. The request_subject (default = /smartcache) is the subject used to send requests to the SmartCache daemon. The request_timeout (default = 10.0) is the amount of time (in seconds) a client waits to receive the cached messages after a request is made to the SmartCache Daemon.

TipcCache

public TipcCache(TipcSrv serverSession,
                 java.lang.String smartCacheSubject,
                 java.lang.String requestTimeout)
Initializes the SmartCache options for request_subject and request_timeout

Parameters:
serverSession - --- The TipcSrv instance to use.
smartCacheSubject - --- The Subject to send requests to SmartCache.
requestTimeout - --- The timeout value for a request to SmartCache. ("10.0")
Method Detail

getVersion

public float getVersion()

requestMsgs

public void requestMsgs(java.lang.String requestSubject)
                 throws TipcException
Requests all messages from the SmartCache daemon without any time contraints. The response messages will be automatically processed as they come in from SmartCache If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist at this time, one will be created.

Parameters:
requestSubject - subject name to retrieve messages.
Throws:
TipcException

requestMsgs

public void requestMsgs(java.lang.String requestSubject,
                        int numMsgs)
                 throws TipcException
Requests 'numMsgs' messages from the SmartCache daemon without any time contraints. The response messages will be automatically processed as they come in from SmartCache If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist at this time, one will be created.

Parameters:
requestSubject - subject name to retrieve messages.
numMsgs - number of messages to be retrieved.
Throws:
TipcException

requestMsgs

public void requestMsgs(java.lang.String requestSubject,
                        double deltaTime)
                 throws TipcException
Requests all the messages from the SmartCache daemon within 'deltaTime' number of seconds. The response messages will be automatically processed as they come in from SmartCache If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist at this time, one will be created.

Parameters:
requestSubject - subject name to retrieve messages.
deltaTime - amount of time in seconds to retrieve the message history.
Throws:
TipcException

requestMsgsRpc

public TipcMsg requestMsgsRpc(java.lang.String requestSubject,
                              int numMsgs,
                              double deltaTime)
                       throws TipcException
Requests 'numMsgs' messages from the SmartCache daemon within 'deltaTime' number of seconds. The response message will be returned to the caller. If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist at this time, one will be created.

Parameters:
requestSubject - subject name to retrieve messages.
numMsgs - number of messages to be retrieved.
deltaTime - amount of time in seconds to retrieve the message history.
Returns:
The response message from SmartCache. This is the bundled message of type T_MT_CACHE_RESPONSE. If no message from SmartCache has been received, this method returns null.
Throws:
TipcException

requestMsgs

public void requestMsgs(java.lang.String requestSubject,
                        int numMsgs,
                        double deltaTime)
                 throws TipcException
Requests 'numMsgs' messages from the SmartCache daemon within 'deltaTime' number of seconds. The response messages will be automatically processed as they come in from SmartCache If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist at this time, one will be created.

Parameters:
requestSubject - subject name to retrieve messages.
numMsgs - number of messages to be retrieved.
deltaTime - amount of time in seconds to retrieve the message history.
Throws:
TipcException

requestStart

public void requestStart(java.lang.String cacheSubject)
Submits a message to the SmartCache daemon to start storing all messages being published to the given subject. If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist, one will be created.

Parameters:
cacheSubject - name of subject for which messages will be stored.

requestStart

public void requestStart(java.lang.String cacheSubject,
                         double deltaTime)
Submits a message to the SmartCache daemon to start storing all messages being published to the given subject within 'deltaTime' seconds. If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist, one will be created.

Parameters:
cacheSubject - name of subject for which messages will be stored.
deltaTime - maximum amount of time in seconds that messages will be stored.

requestStart

public void requestStart(java.lang.String cacheSubject,
                         int numMsgs)
Submits a message to the SmartCache daemon to start storing up to 'numMsgs' messages being published to the given subject. If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist, one will be created.

Parameters:
cacheSubject - name of subject for which messages will be stored.
numMsgs - maximum number of messages to be stored for 'cacheSubject'.

requestStart

public void requestStart(java.lang.String cacheSubject,
                         int numMsgs,
                         double deltaTime)
Submits a message to the SmartCache daemon to start storing up to 'numMsgs' messages being published to the given subject within 'deltaTime' seconds. If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist, one will be created.

Parameters:
cacheSubject - name of subject for which messages will be stored.
numMsgs - maximum number of messages to be stored for 'cacheSubject'.
deltaTime - maximum amount of time in seconds that messages will be stored.

requestStop

public void requestStop(java.lang.String cacheSubject)
Submits a message to the SmartCache daemon to stop storing messages being published to the given subject. If a connection to RTserver doesn't exist, one will be created.

Parameters:
cacheSubject - name of subject for which messages will be stored.

GMDInit

public void GMDInit(java.lang.String smartCacheGroup)
GMDInit: Performs initializations required to use SmartCache to cache GMD message from this RTclient. This function must be called prior to any other SmartCache API call and prior to parsing a configuration/command file. It sends a message to to start the GMD message caching.

Parameters:
smartCacheGroup - Subject of the smartcache group.

GMDFinish

public void GMDFinish(java.lang.String smartCacheGroup)
GMDFinish: Performs clean up procedure required to when SmartCache stops to cache GMD message for this RTclient. It sends a message to to stop the GMD message caching.

Parameters:
smartCacheGroup - Subject of the smartcache group.

GMDFlush

public void GMDFlush(java.lang.String reqSubj,
                     java.lang.String reqSender,
                     java.lang.String smartCacheGroup)
GMDFlush: This function is used to flush the SmartCache for cached messages from senders. This function sends a message to SmartCache to delete cached messages for specified subject from specified RTclient. The value reqSubj or reqSender (but not both) can be set to to flush all the subjects or senders.

Parameters:
reqSubj - subject name to flush.
reqSender - sender to flush.
smartCacheGroup - Subject of the smartcache group.
